key_points: There is discussion about a fourth stimulus check following the third checks from the American Rescue Plan.

Options for a fourth stimulus include $2,000 monthly checks, making the child tax credit permanent, giving parents $1,000 monthly checks, extending unemployment insurance, and enacting student loan cancellation.
More than 75 members of Congress support $2,000 monthly checks until the Covid-19 pandemic is over, but President Biden and Congress lack consensus on this.
President Biden proposed making the temporary $300 monthly child tax credit a permanent policy to support families with children.
Senator Josh Hawley introduced a bill for a Parent Tax Credit, providing up to $12,000 per year to support working parents.
Congress could decide to extend supplemental federal unemployment benefits beyond their scheduled expiration.
President Biden has considered student loan cancellation as a form of economic stimulus, exploring avenues including executive action.
Biden's focus on other priorities like infrastructure suggests a fourth stimulus check or monthly payments are currently unlikely.
The existing measures aim to provide financial aid directly or through tax credits to specific groups such as children, parents, and the unemployed.
The possibility and form of any future stimulus payments or financial support measures remain under discussion and subject to legislative approval.
